A "High Quality Charter School"

div.div: Ohio Public Chartered School - Grades KG to 8th

a.span: Like us and share on Facebook

strong.font: Great things are happening at Westside Academy!

div.br:
Schedule a visit to find out if your children would benefit from what our school has to offer the community.
Great teachers, great students, and a great education.
Visit our school's Facebook page to see what's happening and find your child in the latest field trip photos.

div.style: float: left; text-align: left; position: relative;

strong.font: above file is the current school wide teacher's ZOOM classroom meeting schedule.
We have set up a school wide schedule for class meetings in ZOOM to allow all your children to use the same computer at different times.

When they use their school email and school username, they will find an invitation to join Google Classroom. They should log into Google Classroom and register with each class. Each student has the same user name to start, teachers have that user name and can give you and your child access to their username.

letter was mailed to all families on 4-9-2020. Please open it immediately to find your children's school email so they can start registering for their on-line Google Classroom account with Westside Academy.

span.style: font-size: small; color: rgb(63, 63, 63); background-color: transparent;
font-size: small; color: rgb(63, 63, 63); background-color: transparent;
font-size: small; color: rgb(63, 63, 63); background-color: transparent;

font.font:
Dear Parents of Westside Academy,
We hope all our families are safe, and following the new suggested rules for slowing down the Covid-19 virus quarantine. At the school we are working hard to get all our students ready for on-line schooling starting on Monday April 13th.
We have created school email accounts for each students so they can use it to sign into their on-line learning platforms. Each teacher has their student’s emails and has invited students to their classes on Google Classroom.
Your child’s email is:
Teacher: Students Name Students Email
Students in grades K-4, should have a homeroom teacher, a language class, either a Spanish or Arabic class, and a Physical Education (P.E.) class.
Students in grades 5th-7th grade should have an ELA class, a Math class, a Science class, a Social Studies Class, and a Physical Education (P.E.) class.
Each teacher will be sending you, and your child information about Clever, Google Classroom, and ZOOM. Make sure you can access the necessary programs before April 13th. You can speak to your child’s homeroom teacher or call the office. Parent office hours are Tuesday and Thursday from 10 am to 2 pm.
Students who are assigned to Mrs. Edge or Mrs. Orr will have one additional class. Mrs. Orr will be mailing her students packets about every two weeks. She will be having daily ZOOM reading groups, and bi-weekly check in’s using phone calls and emails.
Students assigned to other individual instructors or support staff will also be contacted and expected to be present during individualized class times. Please respond to these teachers communication. The following teacher may be contacting parents:
Kindergarten tutor: Ms. Naima
1st Grade tutor: Ms. Laftifa
4/5th Grade tutor: Mrs. Compton
4th to 7th: NEXSTEP Company Teacher’s for individual class time
Occupational Therapy: Mrs. Wolverton
Speech and Language Therapy: Mrs. Reilly
Evaluations and Individual Education Plans: Dr. Arbolino
Kindergarten and 1st grade teachers are using Dojo. You should have been provided a paper invitation from your child’s teacher. Many parents are already signed up and using the program with their child, but some parents have not responded.
Let me make it very clear that if your child does not complete their work and log in to the above programs and attend classes they will be considered absent and possible received a failing grade. There is a bin at the front door of the school to drop all paper work that needs turned in. The three weeks of work they were given before we left the school is due right away.
Please be patient with our staff as we roll out our new system. The front office is also under a great deal of pressure, please be patient and follow all the social distancing rules.
Sincerely,
Heather O’Bannon
Director

div.div:
​
Covid-19 UPDATE
3-31-20
Greetings Westside Academy family and students,
As you may already know the Governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, has closed schools until May 1st. What does that mean for our school?
First all students must finish the three week of work that was assigned through the end of this week. Next week is spring break.
As of Monday, April 13th we will be using an on-line format to deliver assignments, accept completed work, and have classroom lessons, and tutoring. We will keep you informed about how to access that information next week.
REMEMBER all work must be completed and turned in or students will be marked absent, and assignments will be marked as incomplete. All students are accountable for completing school work. There is a homework return bin at the school under the mailbox.
For now keep looking at the teachers pages under the MORE tab on the right of the home page and Keep watching our videos for updates and information.
3-29-2020
We are no longer serving grab and go lunch and breakfast at the school. Please go to a columbus City School site or a South-Western City School Site. Student report cards. Not all students were tested before we closed. Keep working with your children and following our website for updates.
3-15-2020
We will be serving a grab and go lunch and breakfast at the school for our students this week, Monday 3-16 to Friday 3-20, from 11 am to 12 pm.
Please drive into the north gate, stop your car in front of the daycare door, and wait in your car for a server to bring the sack to your car. Please tell the server your family name and how many of your children are students at our school. They will give you the sack lunch for today and a breakfast for tomorrow. Then drive out the south entrance.
We will let you know if we will have food service next week.
We do not have the ability to serve meals for more than our current student count. If you do not have transportation to our school and live near a free meal service site from Columbus City School, please see the below map and go to one of their locations.
​
We will have limited office hours similar to summer office hours. Please call the school and leave a message if you need to contact us. We will be checking the phone many times a day.
​Early Horizon Learning Center will be open Monday.
SCHOOL CLOSING
COVID-19 3-12-2020
Based on Governor Dewine’s order for all Ohio Schools to be closed due to the COVID-19 virus, we are following South-Western City School closing schedule. Therefore we will be closed from Monday, March 16th through our scheduled spring break and resume school on Monday, April 13th. We will be open Friday, March 13.
The schedule for the month of April will be evaluated as circumstances change.
Teachers are sending homework packets home tomorrow, along with student books, and information on how to access on-line programs and each teacher's page to access from our website under the more tab on the home page. Teachers will be posting classwork, and resources to allow students to continue academic work as well as socializing during the closure.
We understand that providing food for your children during this school closing is something you were not expecting. Our school is working with our food service company to work out a system to provide sack lunches for our students during part of our closing. Check back for more information.
We will continue to monitor how the coronavirus (COVID-19) is impacting our community and our school and plan accordingly in partnership with local, state, and federal health and government officials. For updated communication you must keep us informed with any changes in your address, phone number or emergency contact. If any member of your family has a fever or other symptoms of the COVID-19 virus please call the school to report the information to the school immediately.

div.div:
August - Start of school and parent orientation.
September - Start of the after school BSA Cub Scout program and the first of four parent engagement meetings in the evening.
October - End of the first grading period
November - Parent-teacher conferences and second parent engagement meeting. #rd grade takes the fall English state test
December - Student and staff winter party December 20th.
January - 3rd parent engagement meeting, end of the second grading period, and the second parent-teacher conferences.
February - Students take the OELPA state test.
March - Last parent engagement meeting. 3rd to 7th state testing begins.
April - Last parent-teacher conferences. Spring break.
May - Carnival & BBQ (Students only)
- Field Day (limited parent help, you must sign up prior to the 21st)
- School wide finals Spelling Bee (parents welcome BUT no siblings)
- Awards (parents welcome, dismissal at noon) 7th grade awards at 10 am
2020 SUMMER SCHEDULE
Kindergarten Skills - School Readiness Summer Program: Runs for 6 weeks ,T, W, Th, starts the week of Tuesday, June 23rd and ends Thursday, August 6th. There is no program the week of July 4th. The program hours are 11:30 - 2:30 pm. Parents can pickup students at 2:15– 2:30 p.m. A snack will be provided.
3rd grade summer tutoring for the Ohio State test: T, W, TH, starts Tuesday, June 16th and ends Wednesday, July 8th. The test will be administered on July 9th and/or 10th. From 9:30 –11:30 a.m.
A snack will be provided. No tutoring on July 4th.
The summer Scout camp is available for all students in grades 1st to 5th who signed up for the After School Scouts program. It will be a week long day camp program starting on Monday July 20th and ending on Friday July 24th. Transportation will be provided every day to and from the school to the camp which is located in Delaware, Ohio.
The summer STEM program will not run this summer due to expansion construction. The ​STEM summer School Activities regularly includes: Creaking, Candy Factory Tour, Bowling, Library visit, Gardening, Carnival, & Water day are are planned to resume next summer
​
